what.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used to ask for information or for someone’s opinion
what.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: What subjects did you enjoy most?
What colour is the new carpet?
What do you think of my painting?
What do you mean, you want to spend Christmas alone?
what on earth/in the world/in heaven’s name etc
what.translation[0].definitions[0].note_: When there are only a small number of possible things or people, you use which, not what
what.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to introduce a clause about something that is or was not known or not certain
what.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: No one knows exactly what happened.
It is not clear to what extent these views were shared.
They’re discussing what to do next.
what.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: I believe what he told me.
I could get you a job here if that’s what you want.
What he did was morally wrong.
She gave him what money she had  (=all the money she had, although she did not have much).
what.translation[0].definitions[2].note_: What is not a relative pronoun and should not be used to begin a clause after a noun or pronoun Use that instead You say
There are so many things that can go wrong
There are so many things what can go wrong
what.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used at the beginning of a statement to emphasize what you are going to say
what.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: What that kid needs is some love and affection.
What we’ll do is leave a note for Mum to tell her we won’t be back till late.
What matters is the British people and British jobs.
what.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: used at the beginning of a sentence to emphasize that you think something or someone is very good, very bad etc
what.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: What a horrible thing to do!
what.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used to ask someone to complete a name when they have only given you the first part of it
what.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: ‘Do you know his name?’ ‘It’s David.’ ‘David what?’
what.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: used to give yourself time to think before guessing a number or amount
what.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: You’re looking at, what, about £4,000 for a decent second-hand car.
what.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: used to ask someone to repeat something they have just said because you did not hear it properly
what.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: ‘Could you turn the music down a bit?’ ‘What?’
what.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: used when you have heard someone calling to you and you are asking them what they want
what.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: used to show that you are surprised or shocked by something that someone has just said
